name: Yerevan City tour
short_description: We will have a familiarization tour of the capital.
description: We will have a familiarization tour of the capital. The first stop would be in the Victory Park, at Mother Armenia monument, from where you will behold a panoramic view of the city. After which we will visit the “Museum under the open air” monument of Cascade to see many nice statues from different artists all over the world. Our trip will be concluded in the Verisage open air flee market, where people will be able to buy many Armenian souvenirs if time permits.

name: Sevan – Dilijan
short_description: In the morning will travel to "blue eye of Armenia"
description:
In the morning will travel to "blue eye of Armenia" - lake Sevan. This fresh water lake of volcanic origin is situated at an altitude about 6.500 feet. Its crystal - clear transparent water changes color several times during the day. It is turquoise in direct sunlight, then turns a greenish shade, and finally becomes gray by the evening. Sevan has always been famous for its fish, especially trout, a part of the tribute Armenia paid to its conquerors. 
Lunch in the Armenian restaurant near the lake to taste fish from the lake. 
In the afternoon we will visit "Switzerland of Armenia" resort town Dilijan Here we will visit a museum-street of the town of Dilijan, which still preserves 19-century houses. 
Here we visit a wood-carver who still makes Armenian cross­stones - an ancient tradition still surviving to our days.
We will visit the treasure of the forests, the ancient 10th century Monastery complex Haghartsin. Legend tells that stones inside this monastery complex are speaking with those people who would believe in this.

name: Garni – Geghard
short_description: In the morning we will drive east of Yerevan
description:
In the morning we will drive east of Yerevan and visit a unique medieval monastery of Geghard which was included in the list of UNESCO world heritage sites. Some chambers of the monastery were carved out of solid rock and possess exceptional acoustics. Here we will listen to the choir performance inside the chamber. 
We will then continue towards Garni village where we will visit a pagan temple from 1st century AD - the only one remaining from pre-Christian period in Armenia. The temple is located on a triangular cape overlooking the deep canyon of Garni.

name: Echmiadzin – Zvartnots
short_description: We will take a trip to the religious capital of Armenia
description: We will take a trip to the religious capital of Armenia, the town of Echmiadzin. We will first visit the archeological site of Zvartnots Cathedral, which is a masterpiece of Armenian architecture of 7thcentury. The area is a UNESCO’s World Heritage Site. We will then come to the main Cathedral of Echmiadzin. Today it is the Holy See of Echmiadzin, where the Catholicos of Armenia resides. Legend tells that it was here that Jesus Christ descended from Heaven to show where he wanted a church to be built.

name: Khor Virap – Noravank
short_description: The road leads through the plains of Ararat,
description: The road leads through the plains of Ararat, where all of a sudden an attractive picture of Khor – Virab Monastery appears. Today this complex embodies the significant historical event – Adoption of Christianity in Armenia in 301 AD. We stop to see the Complex and make photograph of Ararat Mountain. After two hours ride we enter the world of full – flowing rivers, fascinating waterfalls, caves and snowy mountain peaks of Vayots Dzor Province. We pause near the village of Areni which is famous for its red dry wine. Noravank Monastery is situated on the hill of the twisted gorge, among the freakish plumb rosy cliffs. Noravank Monastery, really the place of breathtaking natural beauty, provides great opportunities for taking pictures

name: Khor Virap – Noravank – Tatev
short_description: In the morning we will drive towards Khor Virap monastery
description: In the morning we will drive towards Khor Virap monastery.  Located at the foot of biblical Mt. Ararat, this complex embodies the adoption of Christianity in Armenia in 301 AD. Then transferred to Noravank monastery with intricate carvings, situated among the freakish plumb rosy cliffs. Here we will have a pleasant walk via old path of monks towards Noravank monastery through picture sque reddish rocks. After drive further to the South. Pause en route to enjoy wine tasting at the village of Areni which is famous for its red dry wine. After short walking the bus transfer to the mountain-top monastery of Tatev, where we can take the longest reversible tramway in the world 5752 m. (not working on Mondays) to reach the medieval complex of 9th century Tatev. Lunch near the monastery. After lunch we will explore one of the most fascinating sites of Armenia.

name: Sevan and Sevanavank
short_description: Ոe will explore so called “the pearl of Armenia”
description: Ոe will explore so called “the pearl of Armenia” – Lake Sevan – one of the largest high-altitude lakes in the world. Sevan is located at 1900m above sea level, surrounded with snow-covered mountains. In old times people called it Geghama See because of it big sizes. Total surface area of the lake is about 1240 m. If we are lucky we will witness the change of colors from the peninsula providing great views of the lake. Here we will also visit a 9th century monastery, once a place of exile for nobility.
